oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Roy Acuff - Bob Allen Interview 1983 Side Two
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is an interview of Roy Acuff by Bob Allen. The recording takes place on 10/05/1983.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Roy Acuff;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Side Two (0:05) -- Continuation of discussion about the crowds that Roy Acuff would draw when performing. (1:58) -- Bob Allen asks about the capacity of The Grand Ole Opry on Fatherland Street. Roy Acuff mentions that it would hold between 800-1200 people. (2:45) -- Bob Allen asks Roy Acuff about his emotional vocal style. Roy Acuff discusses reacting emotionally when he sees a member of the audience crying during a tune. (4:30) -- Roy Acuff discusses his personality in High School and the sports he engaged in. (5:35) -- Bob Allen asks Roy Acuff if he could visit his house in Opryland. Tape cuts to the two speaking at Roy Acuff's Opryland house. (6:48) -- Bob Allen asks Roy Acuff when he first moved to his Opryland house. (7:50) -- Roy Acuff speaks about his house's various rooms. Roy Acuff takes Bob Allen on a tour of his house. (14:15) -- Roy Acuff speaks about his home lifestyle. (15:26) -- TV slowly flickers on, Roy Acuff and Bob Allen focus attention on a baseball game (Orioles vs. Yankees). (18:09) -- Bob Allen asks about Roy Acuff's attempted career in baseball. (19:44) -- Tape cuts to Roy Acuff further explaining the route he takes to get to the auditorium. (20:35) -- Bob Allen asks Roy Acuff whether he would've gone into professional baseball if he never had his sunstroke. (22:20) -- Roy Acuff speaks about the future of country music and Opryland.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Acuff, Roy;
